intro: Soehrensia tarijensis subsp. bertramiana, commonly known as the Tarijensis bertramiana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact shrub form with small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
